text: Caduca albopunctata is a moth of the family Noctuidae first described by Francis Walker in 1857. ==Distribution== It is found in Sri Lanka, the Indian subregion, Taiwan, Thailand, Sundaland and Japan's Iriomote Island and Ishigaki Island. ==Description== The wings are dark blackish brown and fasciated with several series of small white spots. ==Subspecies== Two subspecies are recognized. *Caduca albopunctata albopunctata Walker, 1857 *Caduca albopunctata phronimus Rothschild, 1920 Caduca albopunctata (25372214970).jpg| A32-20120321-P089 (7114919059).jpg| A35-20160307-146 (27054647931).jpg| A43-20170221-082 (33784306680).jpg| A41-20170921-137 (37077563624).jpg| ==References== ==External links== *Sweet Or Savoury? Adult Feeding Preferences of Lepidoptera Attracted to Banana and Prawn Baits in the Oriental Tropics Category:Moths of Asia Category:Moths described in 1857
title: Caduca albopunctata
